title.narrative: SWE-2010-136 Natural resources and ethnic violence in Darfur
SWE-2010-136 Natural resources and ethnic violence in Darfur

description.narrative: In this research project, we use a previously unexploited data set on 542 villages in Southwestern Darfur. Our broad objective is to analyze how a deterioration in natural resources, caused by climate change, contributes to ethnic violence in the area. Our data includes detailed information on the ethnic composition of village populations before and after the conflict, as well as various indicators of natural resources. We have four specific projects: 1) Market collapse in vulnerable environments, a theoretical analysis of land conflict between herders and farmers. 2) A statistical analysis of the determinants of violent attacks on villages. 3) An empirical analysis of land reallocation and population growth in the wake of the conflict. 4) Quantifying ethnic cleansing in the area.

In this research project, we use a previously unexploited data set on 542 villages in Southwestern Darfur. Our data includes detailed information on the ethnic composition of village populations before and after the conflict, as well as various indicators of natural resources. We have four specific projects: 1) Market collapse in vulnerable environments, a theoretical analysis of land conflict between herders and farmers. 2) A statistical analysis of the determinants of violent attacks on villages. 3) An empirical analysis of land reallocation and population growth in the wake of the conflict. 4) Quantifying ethnic cleansing in the area.
